text.p: Here are highlights of stories in Romania's press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy:
Business:
ROMANIA LIBERA
- Government suggested 6.0 percent wage indexation for third quarter of 1996.
ADEVARUL
- Romania's wheat output this year, put at little over 3.0 million tonnes or so, is smallest in country's history.
AZI
- Distribution of land deeds under land reform is slow, with only 64 percent of people entitled to land ownership having got them in five years since reform started.
LIBERTATEA
- Monthly inflation was 3.8 percent in August.
- Reconstruction of Athenee Palace Hotel in central Bucharest is expected to end next spring.
CURIERUL NATIONAL
- Total individual deposits at CEC savings bank rose by 28 billion lei in August to 2.0 trillion lei.
General:
ROMANIA LIBERA
- Police arrested two Turkish citizens who smuggled some 90,000 German marks in forged bills into Romania.
- Former Stalinist dictator Nicolae Ceausescu's youngest son, Nicu, was hospitalised with a serious liver condition.
- President Ion Iliescu was booed in western city of Timisoara during signing of Romanian-Hungarian treaty.
- Analyses of virus causing Romania's meningitis epidemic to continue in London, following failure of French experts to isolate the virus.
- Thirty-two pacients died from an overall of 423 cases of viral meningitis in the country's worst epidemic of this kind.
- Shareholders' meeting of troubled bank Dacia Felix SA approved recovery plan to end-1999.
EVENIMENTUL ZILEI
- Romanian soccer trainer Mircea Lucescu to invest 17.9 billion lei in troubled Dacia Felix for its recovery.
ADEVARUL
- Police investigates case of a surgeon who allegedly took a dead man's eyes from the forensic. A pair of eyes is worth $5,000 on the black market.
- Hungary does not want autonomy on ethnic grounds for Romania's ethnic Hungarians, but it looks for other forms of autonomy, Hungarian Foreign Minister Laszlo Kovacs told the newspaper.
- Parliament expected to debate this month report on events in December 1989 uprise which toppled dictator Ceausescu.
- Businessman Sever Muresan, one of Dacia Felix bank's shareholders, promissed to return 30 billion lei from a debt worth 1100 billion lei.
- Dacia Felix has total debts of 2,000 billion.
LIBERTATEA
- Some 90 schools in Bucharest were banned from reopening due to poor sanitatary condition.
- Opposition Democratic Convention bloc's candidates in November 3 general elections need at least 5 million lei each to pay for their publicity during campaign.
VREMEA
- Romanian-Hungarian treaty is ambiguous and will not bring peace and stability in bilateral ties, Socialist Labour Party leaders said. ($=3,196 lei) -- Bucharest Newsroom 40-1 3120264
